   19: %%
   20: -module(erl_prim_loader_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: -include_lib("kernel/include/file.hrl").
   23: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   24: 
   25: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1, 
   26: 	 init_per_testcase/2,end_per_testcase/2,
   27: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2]).
   28: 
   29: -export([get_path/1, set_path/1, get_file/1, normalize_and_backslash/1,
   30: 	 inet_existing/1, inet_coming_up/1, inet_disconnects/1,
   31: 	 multiple_slaves/1, file_requests/1,
   32: 	 get_modules/1]).
   33: 
   34: -define(PRIM_FILE, prim_file).
   35: 
   36: %%-----------------------------------------------------------------
   37: %% Test suite for erl_prim_loader. (Most code is run during system start/stop.)
   38: %%-----------------------------------------------------------------
   39: 
   40: suite() ->
   41:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   42:      {timetrap,{minutes,3}}].
   43: 
   44: all() -> 
   45:     [get_path, set_path, get_file,
   46:      normalize_and_backslash, inet_existing,
   47:      inet_coming_up, inet_disconnects, multiple_slaves,
   48:      file_requests,
   49:      get_modules].
   50: 
   51: groups() -> 
   52:     [].
   53: 
   54: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   55:     Config.
   56: 
   57: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   58:     ok.
   59: 
   60: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   61:     Config.
   62: 
   63: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   64:     Config.
   65: 
   66: 
   67: init_per_testcase(_Func, Config) ->
   68:     Config.
   69: 
   70: end_per_testcase(_Func, _Config) ->
   71:     ok.
   72: 
   73: get_path(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   74:     case erl_prim_loader:get_path() of
   75: 	{ok, Path} when is_list(Path) ->
   76: 	    ok;
   77: 	_ ->
   78: 	    ct:fail(get_path)
   79:     end,
   80:     ok.
   81: 
   82: set_path(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   83:     {ok, Path} = erl_prim_loader:get_path(),
   84:     ok = erl_prim_loader:set_path(Path),
   85:     {ok, Path} = erl_prim_loader:get_path(),
   86:     NewPath = Path ++ ["dummy_dir","/dummy_dir/dummy_dir"],
   87:     ok = erl_prim_loader:set_path(NewPath),
   88:     {ok, NewPath} = erl_prim_loader:get_path(),
   89: 
   90:     ok = erl_prim_loader:set_path(Path), % Reset path.
   91:     {ok, Path} = erl_prim_loader:get_path(),
   92: 
   93:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch erl_prim_loader:set_path(not_a_list)),
   94:     {ok, Path} = erl_prim_loader:get_path(),
   95:     ok.
   96: 
   97: get_file(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   98:     case erl_prim_loader:get_file("lists" ++ code:objfile_extension()) of
   99: 	{ok,Bin,File} when is_binary(Bin), is_list(File) ->
  100: 	    ok;
  101: 	_ ->
  102: 	    ct:fail(get_valid_file)
  103:     end,
  104:     error = erl_prim_loader:get_file("duuuuuuummmy_file"),
  105:     error = erl_prim_loader:get_file(duuuuuuummmy_file),
  106:     error = erl_prim_loader:get_file({dummy}),
  107:     ok.
  108: 
  109: get_modules(Config) ->
  110:     case test_server:is_cover() of
  111: 	false -> do_get_modules(Config);
  112: 	true -> {skip,"Cover"}
  113:     end.
  114: 
  115: do_get_modules(Config) ->
  116:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  117:     NotADir = atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME) ++ "_not_a_dir",
  118:     ok = file:write_file(filename:join(PrivDir, NotADir), <<>>),
  119:     ok = file:set_cwd(PrivDir),
  120: 
  121:     MsGood = lists:sort([lists,gen_server,gb_trees,code_server]),
  122:     Ms = [certainly_not_existing|MsGood],
  123:     SuccExp = [begin
  124: 		   F = code:which(M),
  125: 		   {ok,Code} = file:read_file(F),
  126: 		   {M,{F,erlang:md5(Code)}}
  127: 	       end || M <- MsGood],
  128:     FailExp = [{certainly_not_existing,enoent}],
  129: 
  130:     io:format("SuccExp = ~p\n", [SuccExp]),
  131:     io:format("FailExp = ~p\n", [FailExp]),
  132: 
  133:     Path = code:get_path(),
  134:     Process = fun(_, F, Code) -> {ok,{F,erlang:md5(Code)}} end,
  135:     {ok,{SuccExp,FailExp}} = get_modules_sorted(Ms, Process, Path),
  136: 
  137:     %% Test that an 'enotdir' error can be handled.
  138:     {ok,{SuccExp,FailExp}} = get_modules_sorted(Ms, Process, [NotADir|Path]),
  139: 
  140:     {ok, Peer, Node, BootPid} = complete_start_node(),
  141:     ThisDir = filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
  142:     true = rpc:call(Node, code, add_patha, [ThisDir]),
  143:     _ = rpc:call(Node, code, ensure_loaded, [?MODULE]),
  144:     {ok,{InetSucc,FailExp}} = rpc:call(Node, erl_prim_loader,
  145: 				       get_modules, [Ms,Process,Path]),
  146:     SuccExp = lists:sort(InetSucc),
  147: 
  148:     peer:stop(Peer),
  149:     unlink(BootPid),
  150:     exit(BootPid, kill),
  151: 
  152:     ok.
  153: 
  154: get_modules_sorted(Ms, Process, Path) ->
  155:     case erl_prim_loader:get_modules(Ms, Process, Path) of
  156: 	{ok,{Succ,FailExp}} ->
  157: 	    {ok,{lists:sort(Succ),lists:sort(FailExp)}};
  158: 	Other ->
  159: 	    Other
  160:     end.
  161: 
  162: normalize_and_backslash(Config) ->
  163:     %% Test OTP-11170
  164:     case os:type() of
  165: 	{win32,_} ->
  166: 	    {skip, "not on windows"};
  167: 	_ ->
  168: 	    test_normalize_and_backslash(Config)
  169:     end.
  170: test_normalize_and_backslash(Config) ->
  171:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
  172:     Dir = filename:join(PrivDir,"\\"),
  173:     File = filename:join(Dir,"file-OTP-11170"),
  174:     ok = file:make_dir(Dir),
  175:     ok = file:write_file(File,"a file to test OTP-11170"),
  176:     {ok,["file-OTP-11170"]} = file:list_dir(Dir),
  177:     {ok,["file-OTP-11170"]} = erl_prim_loader:list_dir(Dir),
  178:     ok = file:delete(File),
  179:     ok = file:del_dir(Dir),
  180:     ok.
  181: 
  182: %% Start a node using the 'inet' loading method,
  183: %% from an already started boot server.
  184: inet_existing(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  185:     BootPid = start_boot_server(),
  186:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(start_node_using_inet_args()),
  187:     {ok,[["inet"]]} = rpc:call(Node, init, get_argument, [loader]),
  188:     peer:stop(Peer),
  189:     unlink(BootPid),
  190:     exit(BootPid, kill),
  191:     ok.
  192: 
  193: %% Start a node using the 'inet' loading method,
  194: %% but start the boot server afterwards.
  195: inet_coming_up(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  196:     {ok, Peer} = ?CT_PEER(#{wait_boot => false, connection => standard_io,
  197:         args => start_node_using_inet_args()}),
  198: 
  199:     %% Wait a while, then start boot server, and wait for node to start.
  200:     ct:sleep({seconds,6}),
  201:     BootPid = start_boot_server(),
  202:     Node = wait_really_started(Peer, 25),
  203: 
  204:     %% Check loader argument, then cleanup.
  205:     {ok,[["inet"]]} = rpc:call(Node, init, get_argument, [loader]),
  206:     peer:stop(Peer),
  207:     unlink(BootPid),
  208:     exit(BootPid, kill),
  209:     ok.
  210: 
  211: wait_really_started(Peer, 0) ->
  212:     ct:fail({not_booted,Peer});
  213: wait_really_started(Peer, N) ->
  214:     case (catch peer:call(Peer, init, get_status, [])) of
  215:         {started, _} ->
  216:             peer:call(Peer, erlang, node, []);
  217:         _ ->
  218:             ct:sleep(1000),
  219:             wait_really_started(Peer, N - 1)
  220:     end.
  221: 
  222: %% Start a node using the 'inet' loading method,
  223: %% then lose the connection.
  224: inet_disconnects(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  225:     BootPid = start_boot_server(),
  226:     unlink(BootPid),
  227:     Self = self(),
  228: 
  229:     %% This process shuts down the boot server during loading.
  230:     Stopper = spawn_link(fun() -> stop_boot(BootPid, Self) end),
  231:     receive
  232:         {Stopper,ready} -> ok
  233:     end,
  234: 
  235:     %% Let the loading begin...
  236:     {ok,Peer} = ?CT_PEER(#{wait_boot => false, connection => 0,
  237:         args => start_node_using_inet_args()}),
  238: 
  239:     %% When the stopper is ready, the slave node should be
  240:     %% looking for a boot server again.
  241:     receive
  242:         {Stopper,ok} ->
  243:             ok;
  244:         {Stopper,{error,Reason}} ->
  245:             ct:fail(Reason)
  246:     after 60000 ->
  247:             ct:fail(stopper_died)
  248:     end,
  249: 
  250:     %% Start new boot server to see that loading is continued.
  251:     BootPid2 = start_boot_server(),
  252:     Node = wait_really_started(Peer, 25),
  253:     {ok,[["inet"]]} = rpc:call(Node, init, get_argument, [loader]),
  254:     peer:stop(Peer),
  255:     unlink(BootPid2),
  256:     exit(BootPid2, kill),
  257:     ok.
  258: 
  259: %% Trace boot server calls and stop the server before loading is finished.
  260: stop_boot(BootPid, Super) ->
  261:     erlang:trace(all, true, [call]),
  262:     1 = erlang:trace_pattern({erl_boot_server,send_file_result,3}, true, [local]),
  263:     BootRef = erlang:monitor(process, BootPid),
  264:     Super ! {self(),ready},
  265:     Result = get_calls(100, BootPid),
  266:     exit(BootPid, kill),
  267:     erlang:trace_pattern({erl_boot_server,send_file_result,3}, false, [local]),
  268:     erlang:trace(all, false, [call]),
  269:     receive
  270: 	{'DOWN',BootRef,_,_, killed} -> ok
  271:     end,
  272:     Super ! {self(),Result}.    
  273: 
  274: get_calls(0, _) ->
  275:     ok;
  276: get_calls(Count, Pid) ->
  277:     receive
  278: 	{trace,_,call,_MFA} ->
  279: 	    get_calls(Count-1, Pid)
  280:     after 10000 ->
  281: 	    {error,{trace_msg_timeout,Count}}
  282:     end.	
  283: 
  284: %% Start nodes in parallel, all using the 'inet' loading method;
  285: %% verify that the boot server manages.
  286: multiple_slaves(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  287:     Args = start_node_using_inet_args(),
  288: 
  289:     NoOfNodes = 10,			% no of slave nodes to be started
  290: 
  291:     Peers = [?CT_PEER(#{wait_boot => {self(), tag}, args => Args}) || _ <- lists:seq(1, NoOfNodes)],
  292: 
  293:     %% "queue up" the nodes to wait for the boot server to respond
  294:     %% (note: test_server supervises each node start by accept()
  295:     %% on a socket, the timeout value for the accept has to be quite 
  296:     %% long for this test to work).
  297:     ct:sleep({seconds,5}),
  298:     %% start the code loading circus!
  299:     BootPid = start_boot_server(),
  300:     %% give the nodes a chance to boot up before attempting to stop them
  301:     ct:sleep({seconds,10}),
  302: 
  303:     %% wait for all nodes to complete boot process, get their names:
  304:     [
  305:         receive
  306:             {tag, {started, Node, Peer}} ->
  307:                 {ok,[["inet"]]} = rpc:call(Node, init, get_argument, [loader])
  308:         end
  309:         || {ok, Peer} <- Peers
  310:     ],
  311:     [peer:stop(Peer) || {ok, Peer} <- Peers],
  312: 
  313:     unlink(BootPid),
  314:     exit(BootPid, kill),
  315:     ok.
  316: 
  317: 
  318: %% Start a node using the 'inet' loading method,
  319: %% verify that the boot server responds to file requests.
  320: file_requests(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  321:     {ok, Peer, Node, BootPid} = complete_start_node(),
  322: 
  323:     %% compare with results from file server calls (the
  324:     %% boot server uses the same file sys and cwd)
  325:     {ok,Files} = file:list_dir("."),
  326:     io:format("Files: ~p~n",[Files]),
  327:     {ok,Files} = rpc:call(Node, erl_prim_loader, list_dir, ["."]),
  328:     {ok,Info} = file:read_file_info(code:which(test_server)),
  329:     {ok,Info} = rpc:call(Node, erl_prim_loader, read_file_info,
  330: 			 [code:which(test_server)]),
  331: 
  332:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
  333:     Dir = filename:join(PrivDir,?MODULE_STRING++"_file_requests"),
  334:     ok = file:make_dir(Dir),
  335:     Alias = filename:join(Dir,"symlink"),
  336:     case file:make_symlink(code:which(test_server), Alias) of
  337: 	{error, enotsup} ->
  338: 	    %% Links not supported on this platform
  339: 	    ok;
  340: 	{error, eperm} ->
  341: 	    {win32,_} = os:type(),
  342: 	    %% Windows user not privileged to create symlinks"
  343: 	    ok;
  344: 	ok ->
  345: 	    %% Reading file info for link should return file info for
  346: 	    %% link target
  347: 	    {ok,Info} = rpc:call(Node, erl_prim_loader, read_file_info,
  348: 				 [Alias]),
  349: 	    #file_info{type=regular} = Info,
  350: 	    {ok,#file_info{type=symlink}} =
  351: 		rpc:call(Node, erl_prim_loader, read_link_info,
  352: 			 [Alias])
  353:     end,
  354: 
  355:     {ok,Cwd} = file:get_cwd(),
  356:     {ok,Cwd} = rpc:call(Node, erl_prim_loader, get_cwd, []),
  357:     case file:get_cwd("C:") of
  358: 	{error,enotsup} ->
  359: 	    ok;
  360: 	{ok,DCwd} ->
  361: 	    {ok,DCwd} = rpc:call(Node, erl_prim_loader, get_cwd, ["C:"])
  362:     end,
  363: 
  364:     peer:stop(Peer),
  365:     unlink(BootPid),
  366:     exit(BootPid, kill),
  367:     ok.
  368: 
  369: %%%
  370: %%% Helper functions.
  371: %%%
  372: 
  373: complete_start_node() ->
  374:     BootPid = start_boot_server(),
  375:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(start_node_using_inet_args()),
  376:     {ok, Peer, Node, BootPid}.
  377: 
  378: start_boot_server() ->
  379:     %% Many linux systems define:
  380:     %%   127.0.0.1 localhost
  381:     %%   127.0.1.1 somehostname
  382:     %% Therefore, to allow the tests to work on those kind of systems,
  383:     %% also include "localhost" in the list of allowed hosts.
  384: 
  385:     Hosts = [host(),ip_str("localhost")],
  386:     {ok,BootPid} = erl_boot_server:start_link(Hosts),
  387:     BootPid.
  388: 
  389: start_node_using_inet_args() ->
  390:     IpStr = ip_str(host()),
  391:     ["-loader", "inet", "-hosts", IpStr].
  392: 
  393: 
  394: ip_str({A, B, C, D}) ->
  395:     lists:concat([A, ".", B, ".", C, ".", D]);
  396: ip_str(Host) ->
  397:     {ok,Ip} = inet:getaddr(Host, inet),
  398:     ip_str(Ip).
  399: 
  400: host() ->
  401:     {ok,Host} = inet:gethostname(),
  402:     Host.
